intro: Elwendia caroides, commonly known as the golden star vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Aristolochiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces a distinctive, aromatic odor that attracts pollinators such as insects and birds. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Elwendia caroides is typically found growing in moist, shaded environments in tropical forests.
